meanings.definition: Tending or apt to intrude; coming without invitation or welcome.
meanings.sent1: The intrusive neighbor always showed up uninvited to our backyard parties.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson's intrusive behavior made customers feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The intrusive squirrel kept sneaking into the bird feeder, looking for snacks.
meanings.sent4: Her intrusive questions felt like a spotlight shining on my private life.
meanings.sent5: The intrusive smell of burnt popcorn lingered in the office for hours.

meanings.sent1: The intrusive security measures made entering the building a hassle.
meanings.sent2: The intrusive paparazzi followed the celebrity everywhere, invading her privacy.
meanings.sent3: The intrusive cat knocked over the vase, thinking it was a toy.
meanings.sent4: The intrusive noise of construction disrupted the peaceful neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The intrusive glare of the spotlight blinded the performer momentarily.

meanings.definition: Forcing into a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The new policy intrudes on employees' personal time by requiring weekend work.
meanings.sent2: The landlord intruded into the tenant's apartment without notice.
meanings.sent3: The curious puppy intruded into the room, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The loud music intruded into my thoughts, making it hard to concentrate.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors intruded into the otherwise monochrome painting, creating a striking contrast.
